pageContext.claim: “I have been telling this to every group of 50,000 people or 25,000 people – because no one got people in their rallies as big as I did.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump often boasted of the crowd size of his rallies, but has also eagerly inflated this number. The highest turnout would have likely been in Mobile, Ala., where an estimated 30,000 people attended. Other candidates also had large turnout. The campaign of Sen. Bernie Sanders said its rally in Portland attracted 28,000 people, and the next day 27,500 came to an event in Los Angeles.
